title: Superior tools for measuring obesity at the individual level
content: Peter uses other tools to measure obesity; DEXA scans provide 4 points of information: 1) % body fat 2) Visceral fat (VAT, visceral adipose tissue) 3) Bone mineral density 4) Appendicular Lean Mass Index, a measure of muscle mass. It also provides information about subcutaneous fat, but that doesnâ€™t seem to matter because it is incredibly genetic and relatively uncoupled from metabolic health. VAT, the visceral adipose tissue seems to be much more tightly correlated to what we see when we look at more sophisticated biomarkers of insulin sensitivity and metabolic health, and any evidence of liver fat. Peter wonders if at the population level, something better than BMI will come alone one day.

title: Nutrition Science Initiative (NuSI)
content: He has also served on the Scientific Advisory Board for the Nutrition Science Initiative (NuSI).

title: Research Interests
content: Dr. Allison's research interests include obesity and nutrition.

title: Editorial Boards
content: Dr. Allison has contributed to many editorial boards, including Nutrition Today and American Journal of Clinical Nutrition.
